DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of the study is to compare the treatment by wearing shoes inclined at kinesitherapy because it is the first treatment offered by primary care physicians in chronic Achilles tendinopathy.
DOC.brief_title: Reeducation of Chronic Achilles Tendinopathy by Wearing Shoes Inclined Versus Reeducation by Kinesitherapy
DOC.criteria: Age: 1875 years Disease: chronic Achilles tendinopathy de novo or recurrent confirmed by ultrasound Patients having signed the informed consent for the study participation Patients covered by medical insurance Patients having no behavioral disorders History of rupture of the Achilles tendon (= stage 4) Antibiotic treatment tendinotoxique (Quinolones, ...) Inability to walk more than 30 minutes per day. Haglund Syndrome Treatment of tendinopathy or being older than six months Minors Major trust
